item.title: 第三季度利润不佳，预期下调，CNH 工业股价下跌
item.description: 由于需求疲软和经销商库存需求减少，这家农用和建筑设备制造商第三季度利润未达预期，并下调了 2024 年的利润预期。【原文：Shares of CNH Industrial fell more than 10% premarket on Friday, after the farm and construction equipment maker missed third-quarter profit estimates and cut its 2024 profit forecast due to weak demand and reduced dealer inventory requirements.】

item.title: 中国最新刺激政策低于预期
item.description: 周五，希望中国宣布为正在准备迎接唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）再次担任总统的经济提供额外财政缓冲的投资者们失望了。【原文：Investors hoping China would announce extra fiscal buffers for an economy girding for another Donald Trump presidency were disappointed on Friday.】

item.title: 派拉蒙全球公司因票房疲软、有线电视业务下滑而未能实现销售额
item.description: 派拉蒙全球公司周五公布的季度营收不及预期，原因是票房缺乏爆款以及有线电视业务的下滑抵消了其流媒体服务在 NFL 内容回归后好于预期的用户增长。【原文：Paramount Global missed quarterly revenue estimates on Friday as a lack of big hits at the box office and declines in its cable business outweighed better-than-expected subscriber growth at its streaming service after the return of NFL content.】

item.title: 宜家报告利润增加，尽管降价导致收入减少
item.description: 全球最大家具品牌宜家家居（Inter IKEA）的所有者报告称，尽管在 BILLY 书柜等一系列产品降价后收入急剧下降，但由于利息支出减少，2024 年的利润增加了。【原文：Inter IKEA, the owner of the world's biggest furniture brand, reported higher profits for 2024 thanks to lower interest payments, despite a sharp decline in revenues after it cut prices across its range of products like BILLY bookcases.】

item.title: 尽管金价高企，历峰集团仍对提高珠宝价格持谨慎态度
item.description: 周五，历峰集团高管表示，尽管近几个月来黄金价格飙升，但卡地亚的所有者历峰集团计划在提高珠宝价格方面坚持谨慎的态度，目前还没有计划在未来几个月内提价。【原文：Cartier owner Richemont plans to stick to its cautious approach to raising prices of jewellery despite the soaring price of gold in recent months, and has no plans yet for price increases in the upcoming months, executives said on Friday.】

item.title: 路透社/益普索民调显示，大多数美国人预计特朗普将增加美国债务
item.description: 路透社/益普索（Reuters/Ipsos）最新民调显示，大多数美国人认为当选总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）将在新任期内把美国政府推向更深的债务困境，尽管大多数共和党人并不像民主党人那样对他的财政管理感到担忧。【原文：Most Americans believe President-elect Donald Trump will push the U.S. government deeper into debt in his new term, though most Republicans do not share Democrats' concerns over his fiscal stewardship, according to a new Reuters/Ipsos poll.】

item.title: 早间交易大选后华尔街因美联储减息和中国刺激而繁荣
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 沃尔玛将为独立驾驶员提供新的节日奖金，与亚马逊一决高下
item.description: 沃尔玛告诉路透社，该零售商将向独立送货司机支付新的经济奖励，鼓励他们在假日期间到美国商店收取在线订单并将其送到购物者手中。【原文：Walmart will pay independent delivery drivers new financial incentives to pick up online orders at its U.S. stores and deliver them to shoppers during the holiday season, the retailer told Reuters.】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，台积电将从下周一起暂停为中国生产先进的人工智能芯片
item.description: 英国《金融时报》周五援引三位知情人士的话报道称，台湾半导体制造公司已通知中国芯片设计公司，从下周一起暂停生产其先进的人工智能芯片。【原文：Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company has notified Chinese chip design companies that it is suspending production of their advanced AI chips from Monday, Financial Times reported on Friday, citing three people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 巴西飞机制造商巴西航空工业公司第三季度利润增至 2.07 亿美元
item.description: 巴西飞机制造商巴西航空工业公司（Embraer）在周五提交的一份证券文件中称，该公司第三季度调整后净利润从去年同期的 1.67 亿雷亚尔飙升至 11.8 亿雷亚尔（约合 2.073 亿美元）。【原文：Brazilian planemaker Embraer's third-quarter adjusted net profit soared to 1.18 billion reais ($207.30 million) from 167 million reais a year earlier, it said in a securities filing on Friday.】

item.title: VIEW 中国提高地方政府债务上限以振兴经济
item.description: 中国最高立法机构周五批准了一项法案，允许地方政府在三年内发行6万亿元人民币（约合8,388亿美元）债券，用于置换表外债务或 "隐性 "债务，以刺激疲软的经济。【原文：China top legislative body approved a bill on Friday to allow local governments to issue 6 trillion yuan ($838.8 billion) in bonds to swap for off-balance sheet or "hidden" debt over three years, as policymakers sought to spur the sluggish economy.】

item.title: 结交新朋友，促进招聘：中国芯片业计划如何应对特朗普
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）担任美国总统后的四年里，中国的半导体行业正在加紧采购外国芯片制造设备，并寻找机会聘用海外人才和建立新的联盟，从而为未来四年的战斗做好准备。【原文：China's semiconductor industry is readying itself for four more combative years under Donald Trump as U.S. president by ramping up purchases of foreign chipmaking equipment and looking out for opportunities to hire overseas talent and forge new alliances.】

item.title: 成本上升导致新加坡航空公司半年利润减少近一半
item.description: 新加坡航空公司（SIA）周五公布的半年报显示，利润同比减少近一半，反映出市场竞争加剧，加上燃油成本和费用增加。【原文：Singapore Airlines (SIA) reported a half-year profit on Friday that nearly halved year-on-year, reflecting intensifying market competition coupled with higher fuel costs and expenses.】

item.title: 金发女郎不在了？新兴市场在特朗普治下前途未卜
item.description: 在全球加息多年之后，投资者希望新兴市场在 2025 年迎来 "金鸡独立 "的时刻，但在唐纳德-特朗普即将重返白宫之前，投资者正面临着巨大的不确定性。【原文：Investors hoping for a "Goldilocks" moment for emerging markets in 2025 following years of global interest rate hikes are grappling with significant uncertainty ahead of Donald Trump's impending return to the White House.】

item.title: 中国钢铁企业准备应对特朗普关税的间接打击
item.description: 中国钢铁业已经在产能过剩和国内需求疲软的困境中挣扎，如果美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）对中国商品（如用合金制造的制成品）征收 60% 的关税，中国钢铁业将面临间接打击。【原文：China's steel industry, already struggling with overcapacity and weak domestic demand, faces an indirect hit if U.S. President-elect Donald Trump pursues 60% tariffs on Chinese goods such as manufactured items made from the alloy.】

item.title: 标准普尔 500 指数期货突破 6000 点大关，股市因特朗普获胜而走高
item.description: 周五，追踪基准 S&P 500 指数的期货交易突破了 6000 点大关，股市在唐纳德-特朗普重新夺回美国总统宝座和美联储降息的这一周中以乐观的态势收尾。【原文：Futures tracking the benchmark S&P 500 were trading above the 6,000-point mark on Friday, with equity markets set for an upbeat end to an action-packed week that saw Donald Trump recapture the U.S. presidency and the Federal Reserve cut rates.】

item.title: 东南亚为逃离特朗普对华关税的工厂做好准备
item.description: 该地区的工业园区开发商表示，由于预计唐纳德-特朗普重掌白宫后将对中国政府征收高额关税，企业纷纷将工厂从中国迁往东南亚。【原文：Companies have been moving factories from China to Southeast Asia, anticipating Donald Trump would slap high tariffs on Beijing if he regained the White House, a move set to accelerate with his election win, industrial park developers in the region say.】

item.title: 葡萄牙目标 2025 年出售 TAP 航空公司，超过 12 家潜在买家表现出兴趣
item.description: 葡萄牙基础设施部长表示，葡萄牙政府计划在 2025 年恢复出售国旗航空公司葡萄牙航空（TAP），此前已有十多家潜在买家对此表示出兴趣。【原文：Portugal's government plans to resume the sale of flag carrier TAP in 2025, the country's infrastructure minister said, after receiving interest from more than a dozen potential buyers.】

item.title: 历峰集团预计，随着大选不确定性的消除，美国市场将回暖
item.description: 本周总统大选投票后，大选前的不确定性已经消除，历峰集团在美国的业务可能会得到提振，但现在就断言唐纳德-特朗普可能提高关税会对这家奢侈品公司产生怎样的影响还为时尚早。【原文：Richemont's U.S. business could get a boost now that pre-election uncertainty following this week's presidential poll is out of the way, although it is too early to say how possible tariff hikes under Donald Trump would affect the luxury company.】

item.title: 美国、英国和瑞典纷纷降息
item.description: 美国、英国和瑞典本周都下调了利率，尽管唐纳德-特朗普赢得美国大选带来了新的不确定性因素，因为有可能提高关税。【原文：The United States, Britain and Sweden all cut interest rates this week, even as Donald Trump's U.S. election win introduced a fresh element of uncertainty given the threat of higher tariffs.】

item.title: 中国通过地方政府债务置换启动 1.4 万亿美元财政支持计划
item.description: 周五，中国启动了新一轮财政支持计划，以缓解地方政府的偿债压力，同时财政部长蓝佛安也表示将采取进一步的刺激措施。【原文：China kicked off a fresh round of fiscal support on Friday for its sputtering economy with a package that eases debt repayment strains for local governments, with Finance Minister Lan Foan signalling further stimulus in the pipeline.】

item.title: 爱尔兰的财政命运突然与特朗普的经济议程联系在一起
item.description: 如果唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）兑现选前承诺，那么爱尔兰独特的低税收商业模式对美国的影响可能会使其公共财政面临重大风险。【原文：The unique exposure of Ireland's low-tax business model to the United States could place its public finances at significant risk under a Donald Trump presidency - if he follows through on pre-election promises.】

item.title: 特朗普入主白宫如何真正帮助中国和日本市场
item.description: 随着唐纳德-特朗普重返白宫，亚洲甚至中国正在成为令人惊讶的弹性投资市场，基金经理们乐观地认为，该地区比欧洲更能承受关税。【原文：Asia and even China are shaping up as surprisingly resilient investment markets as Donald Trump returns to the White House, with fund managers optimistic the region can withstand tariffs better than Europe.】

item.title: 索尼上半年运营利润增长 42
item.description: 索尼公司周五发布报告称，在截至今年 3 月的上半财年中，该公司的营业利润飙升了 42.3%。【原文：Sony's operating profit soared 42.3% in the first half of the financial year ending March, the company reported on Friday.】

item.title: 中国驻美大使：贸易战、工业战没有赢家
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普赢得美国总统大选后，中国驻美国大使表示，关税战或贸易战没有赢家，科技战或工业战也没有赢家。【原文：There are no winners in tariff or trade wars, nor in wars over science and technology or industry, China's ambassador to the United States said after Donald Trump won the U.S. presidential election.】

item.title: 卡地亚所有者历峰集团第二季度销售额下滑
item.description: 卡地亚珠宝的所有者历峰集团（Richemont）周五报告称，在截至 9 月底的三个月里，该集团的销售额下降了 1%，这是最近一家因中国经济疲软而面临更严峻形势的奢侈品公司。【原文：Cartier jewellery owner Richemont reported on Friday a 1% dip in sales during the three months to the end of September, the latest luxury company to report tougher conditions as China weakened.】

item.title: 准备好了吗？中国如何应对特朗普的第二次冲击
item.description: 八年前，唐纳德-特朗普首次入主白宫后，中国领导人对他的关税和激烈言辞作出了强硬回应，导致贸易战爆发，全球最大经济体之间的关系跌至多年来的最低点。【原文：After Donald Trump first stormed the White House eight years ago, rattled Chinese leaders responded to his tariffs and fiery rhetoric with force, resulting in a trade war that plunged ties between the globe's largest economies to multiyear lows.】

item.title: 早间竞价：刺激经济的希望使股市创下历史新高
item.description: 周五欧洲和全球市场展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Friday】

item.title: 特朗普计划为美联储降息蒙上阴影，债券反弹前景不明
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普重返白宫后，预计将推行财政扩张政策，这可能会抑制美联储未来的降息幅度，因此，280 亿美元的美国政府债券市场近期反弹的前景正在动摇。【原文：Prospects of a near-term rebound in the $28-trillion U.S. government bond market are faltering, as Donald Trump’s return to the White House is expected to usher in fiscally expansive policies that could temper the extent of the Federal Reserve's future rate cuts.】

item.title: 工会称，Allegiant 航空公司飞行员投票批准罢工行动
item.description: 美国卡车司机工会（Teamsters union）周四表示，Allegiant Air 的飞行员已投票赞成，如果航空公司未能达成公平协议，将授权采取罢工行动。【原文：Allegiant Air's pilots have voted in favor of authorizing a strike action if the carrier fails to reach a fair agreement, the Teamsters union said on Thursday.】
